projects.title: Organizer Seminar Series / Book Project: "Human Rights in Essential Public Service Provision"
projects.description:
This Seminar Series, organized at the University of Groningen in 2013-2014, explores the role of human rights law in regulating the provision of essential public services to all members of the public (this includes access to water, electricity,  healthcare services, essential medicines, disaster management, and other services) from a ‘law and governance’ perspective. We explored the relevant human rights standards applicable, such as the AAAQ-standard, minimum core obligations, progressive realization, or the role of private actors in governing access to services delivery, as well as 'accountability' and 'participation'. 

Visit our website for more details on the Series and individual sessions:
http://www.rug.nl/rechten/congressen/stir/human-rights-seminar-series/

profile_positions.description: I joined the Faculty of Law as a Lecturer in International Law in 2009, followed by the position of Assistant Professor after completion of my PhD. Over the years, I have taught broadly in the fields of public international law, human rights law, international environmental law and international climate law, in all years of the LLB and LLM. That includes our top-ranking LLM International (Human Rights) Law and LLM Energy and Climate Law. I also teach public international law to international relations students.
